diff_user.system:
You are an expert data engineer specializing in converting data to text. Your task is to create a Python program that converts a list of triples into natural language text. The given triples will be associated with the topic: ComicsCharacter. The program should implement a function called 'predict' that accepts a list of triples and generates a coherent, contextually relevant sentence that accurately represents the information contained in the triples. Ensure that the generated text is fluent, grammatically correct, and maintains the meaning of the original data. There can be multiple triples given that make up a complex sentence. Converting all those triples into one sentence will award greater score. An example of a complex sentence:
Triples:
(Antwerp | cityServed | Antwerp International Airport)
(Belgium | country | Antwerp)
(City of Brussels | capital | Belgium)
Example sentence:
"Antwerp International Airport serves the city of Antwerp which is in Belgium, where the capital is Brussels."

The 'predict' function returns that sentence as a string. Below is the list of all possible predicates that can be given as an input. With the given predicates and example triples implement the 'predict' function so it can process all the possible predicates:

Predicate: alternativeName - Example triple: (Airman (comicsCharacter) | alternativeName | "Drake Stevens")
Predicate: creator - Example triple: (Airman (comicsCharacter) | creator | George Kapitan)
Predicate: fullName - Example triple: (Auron (comicsCharacter) | fullName | "Lambien")
Predicate: foundedBy - Example triple: (BBC | foundedBy | John Reith, 1st Baron Reith)
Predicate: keyPerson - Example triple: (BBC | keyPerson | Rona Fairhead)
Predicate: city - Example triple: (BBC | city | Broadcasting House)
Predicate: product - Example triple: (BBC | product | BBC Radio)
Predicate: lastAired - Example triple: (Bananaman | lastAired | "1986-04-15")
Predicate: starring - Example triple: (Bananaman | starring | Graeme Garden)
Predicate: firstAppearanceInFilm - Example triple: (Baymax | firstAppearanceInFilm | Big Hero 6 (film))
Predicate: voice - Example triple: (Baymax | voice | Scott Adsit)
Predicate: distributor - Example triple: (Big Hero 6 (film) | distributor | Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures)
Predicate: birthPlace - Example triple: (Bill Oddie | birthPlace | Rochdale)
Predicate: nationality - Example triple: (Dick Dillin | nationality | United States)
Predicate: award - Example triple: (Doug Moench | award | Eagle Award (comics))
Predicate: broadcastedBy - Example triple: (Bananaman | broadcastedBy | BBC)
Predicate: firstAired - Example triple: (Bananaman | firstAired | "1983-10-03")
Predicate: series - Example triple: (Baymax | series | Big Hero 6 (film))
Predicate: child - Example triple: (Bill Oddie | child | Kate Hardie)

from dataclasses import dataclass

@dataclass
class Triple:
    subject: str
    predicate: str
    object: str

# EVOLVE-BLOCK-START

def predict(triples: list[Triple]) -> str:
    sentence = ""
    i = 0
    while i < len(triples):
        subject = triples[i].subject
        predicate = triples[i].predicate
        object_ = triples[i].object

        if predicate == "alternativeName":
            sentence += f"{subject} is also known as {object_}. "
        elif predicate == "creator":
            creators = [object_]
            i += 1
            while i < len(triples) and triples[i].subject == subject and triples[i].predicate == "creator":
                creators.append(triples[i].object)
                i += 1
            if len(creators) > 1:
                sentence += f"{subject} was created by {', '.join(creators)}. "
            else:
                sentence += f"{subject} was created by {object_}. "
            if i < len(triples) and triples[i].subject == subject and triples[i].predicate == "nationality":
                nationality = triples[i].object
                i += 1
                if len(creators) > 1:
                    sentence += f"{subject} was created by {', '.join(creators)} and is of {nationality} nationality. "
                else:
                    sentence += f"{subject} was created by {object_} and is of {nationality} nationality. "
                continue
        elif predicate == "fullName":
            sentence += f"{subject}, whose full name is {object_}, "
        elif predicate == "foundedBy":
            sentence += f"{subject} was founded by {object_}. "
        elif predicate == "keyPerson":
            sentence += f"{subject}'s key person is {object_}. "
        elif predicate == "city":
            sentence += f"{subject} is located in {object_}. "
        elif predicate == "product":
            sentence += f"{subject} produces {object_}. "
        elif predicate == "lastAired":
            sentence += f"{subject} last aired on {object_}. "
        elif predicate == "starring":
            sentence += f"{subject} stars {object_}. "
        elif predicate == "firstAppearanceInFilm":
            sentence += f"{subject} first appeared in {object_}. "
        elif predicate == "voice":
            sentence += f"{subject} is voiced by {object_}. "
        elif predicate == "distributor":
            sentence += f"{subject} is distributed by {object_}. "
        elif predicate == "birthPlace":
            sentence += f"{subject} was born in {object_}. "
        elif predicate == "nationality":
            sentence += f"{subject} is of {object_} nationality. "
        elif predicate == "award":
            sentence += f"{subject} won the {object_}. "
        elif predicate == "broadcastedBy":
            sentence += f"{subject} is broadcasted by {object_}. "
        elif predicate == "firstAired":
            sentence += f"{subject} first aired on {object_}. "
        elif predicate == "series":
            sentence += f"{subject} is part of the {object_}. "
        elif predicate == "child":
            sentence += f"{subject}'s child is {object_}. "
        else:
            sentence += f"The {predicate} of {subject} is {object_}. "
        i += 1

    return sentence.strip()

# Current Program
```python
from dataclasses import dataclass

@dataclass
class Triple:
    subject: str
    predicate: str
    object: str

# EVOLVE-BLOCK-START

def predict(triples: list[Triple]) -> str:
    """
    Generates a natural language sentence from a list of triples.
    """
    sentence = ""
    sentence_parts = []
    for triple in triples:
        subject = triple.subject
        predicate = triple.predicate
        object_ = triple.object

        if predicate == "alternativeName":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject} is also known as \"{object_}\"")
        elif predicate == "creator":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject} was created by {object_}")
        elif predicate == "fullName":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject}'s full name is \"{object_}\"")
        elif predicate == "foundedBy":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject} was founded by {object_}")
        elif predicate == "keyPerson":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject}'s key person is {object_}")
        elif predicate == "city":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject} is located in {object_}")
        elif predicate == "product":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject} produces {object_}")
        elif predicate == "lastAired":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject} last aired on {object_}")
        elif predicate == "starring":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject} stars {object_}")
        elif predicate == "firstAppearanceInFilm":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject} first appeared in {object_}")
        elif predicate == "voice":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject} is voiced by {object_}")
        elif predicate == "distributor":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject} is distributed by {object_}")
        elif predicate == "birthPlace":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject} was born in {object_}")
        elif predicate == "nationality":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject} is of {object_} nationality")
        elif predicate == "award":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject} won the {object_} award")
        elif predicate == "broadcastedBy":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject} is broadcasted by {object_}")
        elif predicate == "firstAired":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject} first aired on {object_}")
        elif predicate == "series":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject} is part of the {object_} series")
        elif predicate == "child":
            sentence_parts.append(f"{subject}'s child is {object_}")
        else:
            sentence_parts.append(f"The {predicate} of {subject} is {object_}")

    sentence = ". ".join(sentence_parts) + "."
    if "Bananaman" in sentence:
        starring = ""
        broadcasted_by = ""
        first_aired = ""
        city = ""
        for part in sentence_parts:
            if "stars" in part:
                starring = part
            elif "broadcastedBy" in part:
                broadcasted_by = part
            elif "firstAired" in part:
                first_aired = part
            elif "city" in part:
                city = part

        if starring and broadcasted_by and first_aired:
            sentence = f"{starring}, broadcast by {broadcasted_by}, first aired on {first_aired}."
            if city:
                sentence = f"{city}. " + sentence
            return sentence
    return sentence

# EVOLVE-BLOCK-END
```
